column4: What would happen if I changed my kernel from xserver to xfree86
I don't understand your question.
xfree86 supports the SIS driver, xserver does not
you mean xorg does not?
SIS integrated graphics you mean? Youre sure xorg doesnt support it?
I just found that xorg supports sis so there is a way
how?  I'ved tried everything
I don't know exactly how but what does not work now? video acceleration? or nothing works at all?
glxgears does not, blender...
install xbase-clients package
never mind you probably have it already
open /etc/X11/xorg.conf   to check if xorg is using the sis driver
what error message do you get while running glxgears?
I get xlib:  "GLX" missing on display : 0  0
Section "Module"  is Load "glx" there?
yes it is
I really don't know much about this. I don't know what to do
how do you comment out something on xorg.config?
with a #
before the line starts. Look at the top of the file
check this out: http://www.winischhofer.at/linuxsisvga.shtml
